siteMetadata.title: csnotehub
siteMetadata.subtitle: Tips for CS, IT, and CpE university students!

frontmatter.title: Stacks
frontmatter.description: Stacks are homogenous data structures (they can only store elements of the same kind) like arrays, but they're different from normal arrays such that you can only add or remove items from the top of the stack. This nature is also called, Last in, First out (LIFO)

frontmatter.title: Structs
frontmatter.description: Structs or structures in c++ are collections of related data items, possibly of different types (heterogenous).
